meanings.definition: The state or quality of being highly mutable or prone to mutation.
meanings.sent1: The hypermutability of the virus allowed it to quickly adapt to new environments.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study hypermutability in organisms to understand genetic changes.
meanings.sent3: The hypermutability of the computer program made it impossible to predict its behavior.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas had a hypermutability that kept her friends constantly surprised.
meanings.sent5: The hypermutability of the weather in the mountains made planning a picnic risky.
